definition: not feel ashamed to ask and learn from one's subordinates
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: If you want to learn, you must not be above asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 你如果要學習，就要不恥下問。

sentences.english: Do not shamed ask others about studying.
sentences.chinese: 在學習上應當不恥下問。

sentences.english: The director condescended to take advice from the stagehand.
sentences.chinese: 導演向舞臺管理人員不恥下問。

sentences.english: If you want to learn, you must not above asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 你如果想學就要不恥下問。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, best of all, she is not above asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 然而，最棒的是她不恥下問。

sentences.english: He did not feel ashamed to ask and learn from his subordinates, so he could manage everything for the best.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他不恥下問，所以他能把各種事情都處理得很好。

sentences.english: You shall not be above asking question.
sentences.chinese: 在學習上應當不恥下問。

sentences.english: When we do not know what to do, we ask.
sentences.chinese: 當我們不懂如何做時，我們不恥下問。

definition: to spend the whole day eating (i.e. not doing any work)
to review the old and know the new (idiom, from the Analects)/to recall the past to understand the future
vigorously pursuing knowledge, while scrupulously abiding by the rules of decorum (idiom)
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
lit. no one picks up lost articles in the street (idiom)/fig. honesty prevails throughout society
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
